base64_from_binary.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_ARCHIVE_ITERATORS_BASE64_FROM_BINARY_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_ARCHIVE_ITERATORS_BASE64_FROM_BINARY_HPP
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00006 # pragma once
00007 #endif
00008 
00010 // base64_from_binary.hpp
00011

00018 
00019 #include <cassert>
00020 
00021 #include <cstddef> // size_t
00022 #include <boost/config.hpp> // for BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME
00023 #if defined(BOOST_NO_STDC_NAMESPACE)
00024 namespace std{ 
00025     using ::size_t; 
00026 } // namespace std
00027 #endif
00028 
00029 #include <boost/serialization/pfto.hpp>
00030 
00031 #include <boost/iterator/transform_iterator.hpp>
00032 #include <boost/archive/iterators/dataflow_exception.hpp>
00033 
00034 namespace boost { 
00035 namespace archive {
00036 namespace iterators {
00037 
00039 // convert binary integers to base64 characters
00040 
00041 namespace detail {
00042 
00043 template<class CharType>
00044 struct from_6_bit {
00045     typedef CharType result_type;
00046     CharType operator()(CharType t) const{
00047         const char * lookup_table = 
00048             "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"
00049             "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
00050             "0123456789"
00051             "+/";
00052         assert(t < 64);
00053         return lookup_table[static_cast<size_t>(t)];
00054     }
00055 };
00056 
00057 } // namespace detail
00058 
00059 // note: what we would like to do is
00060 // template<class Base, class CharType = BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME Base::value_type>
00061 //  typedef transform_iterator<
00062 //      from_6_bit<CharType>,
00063 //      transform_width<Base, 6, sizeof(Base::value_type) * 8, CharType>
00064 //  > base64_from_binary;
00065 // but C++ won't accept this.  Rather than using a "type generator" and
00066 // using a different syntax, make a derivation which should be equivalent.
00067 //
00068 // Another issue addressed here is that the transform_iterator doesn't have
00069 // a templated constructor.  This makes it incompatible with the dataflow
00070 // ideal.  This is also addressed here.
00071 
00072 //template<class Base, class CharType = BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME Base::value_type>
00073 template<
00074     class Base, 
00075     class CharType = BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME boost::iterator_value<Base>::type
00076 >
00077 class base64_from_binary : 
00078     public transform_iterator<
00079         detail::from_6_bit<CharType>,
00080         Base
00081     >
00082 {
00083     friend class boost::iterator_core_access;
00084     typedef transform_iterator<
00085         BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME detail::from_6_bit<CharType>,
00086         Base
00087     > super_t;
00088 
00089 public:
00090     // make composible buy using templated constructor
00091     template<class T>
00092     base64_from_binary(BOOST_PFTO_WRAPPER(T) start) :
00093         super_t(
00094             Base(BOOST_MAKE_PFTO_WRAPPER(static_cast<T>(start))),
00095             detail::from_6_bit<CharType>()
00096         )
00097     {}
00098     // intel 7.1 doesn't like default copy constructor
00099     base64_from_binary(const base64_from_binary & rhs) : 
00100         super_t(
00101             Base(rhs.base_reference()),
00102             detail::from_6_bit<CharType>()
00103         )
00104     {}
00105 //    base64_from_binary(){};
00106 };
00107 
00108 } // namespace iterators
00109 } // namespace archive
00110 } // namespace boost
00111 
00112 #endif // BOOST_ARCHIVE_ITERATORS_BASE64_FROM_BINARY_HPP
